CourseList.Name: Black Hat Go Manual
CourseList.Desc: BHGM is one of the very first manuals that started the whole experimentation behind our product development & design. This was a 200+ page manual on the Go programming language, quick snippets and guides for developing tools or scripts useful for everyday cybersecurity

Author.Name: Totally_Not_A_Haxxer
Author.Biography: Haxxer works as a cybersecurity researcher and the owner of SkyPenguinLabs.

CourseList.Subtitle: Golang snippets & cool little tricks packed into one cheap accessible manual

CourseList.Name: Black Hat Python Manual
CourseList.Desc: Black Hat Python Manual is a simple flipbook filled of unique programs dedicated to the field of cyber security. This booklet starts off talking about the Python programming language going over its command line usage, basic installs, environment variables, and basic functionality with Python, and then starts becoming more advanced.

Author.Name: Totally_Not_A_Haxxer
Author.Biography: Haxxer works as a cybersecurity researcher and the owner of SkyPenguinLabs.

CourseList.Subtitle: BHPM - a quirky, beginner-friendly flipbook packed with unique programs tailored for the world of cybersecurity. Unlike polished textbooks

CourseList.Name: Reverse Engineers Field Manual
CourseList.Desc: Written by Totally_Not_A_Haxxer and published by SkyPenguinLabs, REFM Vol. 1 is a beginner-friendly yet powerful guide designed to help curious minds, ethical hackers, and cybersecurity students understand the theory and practice of reverse engineering.

Author.Name: Totally_Not_A_Haxxer
Author.Biography: Haxxer works as a cybersecurity researcher and the owner of SkyPenguinLabs.

CourseList.Subtitle: quirky, beginner-friendly flipbook packed with unique programs tailored for the world of cybersecurity. Unlike polished textbooks

CourseList.Name: Game Hackers Field Manual
CourseList.Desc: Ever wanted to learn about how game hacks are made? Or how about some of the markets that go into the game-hacking realm? Maybe even going over some of the techniques used to bypass protection systems? This book talks about most things game hacking!

Author.Name: Totally_Not_A_Haxxer
Author.Biography: Haxxer works as a cybersecurity researcher and the owner of SkyPenguinLabs.

CourseList.Subtitle: Unlike a step-by-step coding guide, the Game Hacking Field Manual is designed as a fun, experimental flipbook. It's part of the author's popular 'Field Manual' series, which also includes titles like the Black Hat Go Manual and Black Hat Python Manual.

CourseList.Name: Mathematics & Its Applications In RE
CourseList.Desc: People do not cover the surface area of mathematics and its applications to RE much. This lesson is here to remind beginners how much math goes behind advanced sides of reverse engineering, exploit development, and even tooling & engineering in relation to frameworks like disassemblers.

Author.Name: Totally_Not_A_Haxxer
Author.Biography: Haxxer works as a cybersecurity researcher and the owner of SkyPenguinLabs.

CourseList.Subtitle: REC2 - A small little lesson that introduces you to the different aspects of the way reverse engineering is used

CourseList.Name: Time Managing the Reversing Process
CourseList.Desc: focused breakdown on how to structure your reversing workflow around time-awareness, context-awareness, and environment readiness. Whether you're a student who wants to stop falling into CTF traps, or someone doing reversing work in real engagements, this is going to give you real perspective on how much time you're wasting, and how to gain it all back.

Author.Name: Totally_Not_A_Haxxer
Author.Biography: Haxxer works as a cybersecurity researcher and the owner of SkyPenguinLabs.

CourseList.Subtitle: REC4 - Learn how to manage and optimize your time effectively when reverse engineering! Especially in time tight scenarios...

CourseList.Name: Static Analysis for Ethereum Detection using Go w/ELF
CourseList.Desc: compact, focused digital course designed to teach reverse engineers how to detect Ethereum-based behavior in Linux ELF binaries. You'll walk through how Ethereum interacts with web2.0-style apps, how those apps leave traces, and how to build a lightweight detection tool using Go.

Author.Name: Totally_Not_A_Haxxer
Author.Biography: Haxxer works as a cybersecurity researcher and the owner of SkyPenguinLabs.

CourseList.Subtitle: REC5 - A course that talks about using Golang to statically analyze ELFs

CourseList.Name: Leveraging Go's Stdlib to Create CLI Apps with Little Bloat
CourseList.Desc: the third paid course release from SkyPenguinLabs, aimed squarely at one of the most overinflated corners of Go development: command-line applications bloated with unnecessary third-party libraries. This course RIPS into Go's deep standard library and shows you exactly how to build optimized, sleek, dependency-light CLI tools without sacrificing features, yes, including those pretty box-drawn tables.

Author.Name: Totally_Not_A_Haxxer
Author.Biography: Haxxer works as a cybersecurity researcher and the owner of SkyPenguinLabs.

CourseList.Subtitle: PRGC3 - Tired of installing color libraries in your CLI and having programs getting hijacked? Learn how to not rely on them....

CourseList.Name: Go Modules In Depth For Beginners
CourseList.Desc: PRGC1 is one of the first beginner-accessible courses released under SkyPenguinLabs, focused entirely on breaking down how Go modules actually work under the hood. It's lightweight, beginner-friendly, and packed with practical insight for people just getting serious about working with Go beyond copy-pasting examples from GitHub all within 23 pages. There are even hints at other courses and teasers hidden around :D

Author.Name: Totally_Not_A_Haxxer
Author.Biography: Haxxer works as a cybersecurity researcher and the owner of SkyPenguinLabs.

CourseList.Subtitle: PRGC1 - Go modules are something not everybody is acustomed to, we point some cool things out about them here.
